mdRecord.dcterms:title: Modern Art Museum of Fort Worth, general view
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Tadao Ando, Architect and Associates (Japanese architectural firm, contemporary) [work]
Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Of downtown from museum across reflecting pond

"...located in Fort Worth's celebrated Cultural District, directly opposite the Kimbell Art Museum, designed by Louis I. Kahn, and near the Amon Carter Museum, designed by Philip Johnson. Ando's design, which embodies the pure, unadorned elements of a modern work of art, is comprised of five long, flat-roofed pavilions situated on a 1.5 acre pond." -- http://themodern.org/about-modern/building [work]
